import "./AboutUs.css"; const AboutUs = () => { return (

JMEETAbout Us

"When the Internet is used as a way station on the route to enhancing existing relationships and forging new social connections, it is a useful tool for reducing loneliness. But when social technologies are used to escape the social world and withdraw from the â€œsocial painâ€ of interaction, feelings of loneliness are increased" Loneliness and Social Internet Use: Pathways to Reconnection in a Digital World? (2018), Kexin Wang, Eline Frison, Steven Eggermont, Laura Vandenbosch, We all face loneliness at some point in our lives. Moving to another city, starting uni, joining a sport group â€“ they might pose a social challenge. We often use technology to solve problems, but it seems like social media actually increases this particular problem. Facebook, Instagram and others are built to serve social loneliness â€“ that is the need to have many friends. But on the other side, they increase emotional loneliness, the kind of loneliness in which you miss an intimate tie. Well, we believe that technology can also help us form meaningful friendships, when designed to that purpose. As the Covid-19 crisis immerged on March 2020, we lost the ability to physically meet and form connections. Not only that, connections are no longer spontaneous. On the past year, you probably had to initiate and somehow find people that share the same interests as you. If you succeeded â€“ horray! But if youâ€™re like the rest of us, then Jmeet would be a great solution. This is the reason weâ€™ve created Jmeet: we wish to help the student community in Jerusalem maintain a strong social experience during Covid-19. Our goal is to decrease sense of loneliness by creating an online platform for forming meaningful and intimate connections among students. Jmeet is an application that matches students (like yourself) who have similar interests and is built to bypass both mental and technological obstacles that prevent students from forming new friendships online. We use machine learning to find other students that best matches you, and help to connect. The only members who are allowed on this app are HUJI students, thatâ€™s it. You can choose whether youâ€™d like to meet people in small groups (up to five people) or in person, one-on-one. Sounds good? Sign-up and try it, the worse thing that can happened is that youâ€™ll find you next best friend ğŸ˜Š *this is still a very early BETA version, so there might be problems. We would appreciate your feedback and would love to hear your thoughts. You can send a comment on the â€˜Contact Usâ€™ tab. ); }; export default AboutUs;
